metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5859 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - untriaged.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient filtering in URI schemes in Google Chrome on Windows prior to 76.0.3809.87 allowed a remote attacker to bypass navigation restrictions via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5859` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
